post.title: A city of small signals
post.body: Today I tracked the micro-moments that make a place feel alive: the orange cones, the bus sigh, the tiny nod from someone sharing the crosswalk. If we stitched those signals together, what story would our neighborhoods tell?

comments.body: This reads like a map legend for a city I want to visit. Especially the bus sigh.
We do this in the garden too: small signals that tell you when the soil is ready. Love this framing.
The crosswalk nod is real. It is the most local form of trust.
Your orange cones remind me of the tiles my grandmother used. Same story, different medium.
Have you recorded these signals? I'd love to layer some of them into a soundscape.
This is fascinatingâ€”the signals themselves become a language. Different cities have different dialects.
